Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Dr. Karen Daughtry, Pastor of The House Of The Lord Church, 415 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, New York 11217. 

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Levin.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev.

 Dr. Karen Daughtry, Pastor of the House of the Lord Church, 415 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, N.y. 11217.

Council Member Levin moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of January 8 (Charter),  January 22 (Recessed Meeting), January 22 and February 4, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mendez
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Mendez, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) moved that the Minutes of the Charter Meeting of January 8, 2014, and the Stated Meetings of January 22, 2014 and February 4, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Meera Joshi to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 2301 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Meera Joshi, Taxi and Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter and Section 62-822(a) of the New York City Zoning Resolution, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application nos. C 140132 ZSK, C 140133 ZSK, C 140134 ZSK, C 140135 ZSK and non-ULURP Application no. C 140136 ZAK shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Application no. N 140131 ZRK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, R6/C2-4, R8/C2-4 and C6-2 Districts, Brooklyn (C140132ZSK, C140133ZSK, C140134ZSK, C140135ZSK and C140136ZAK)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to licensing car wash businesses
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Licensing car wash businesses

Items.Title: Resolution urging Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R.1726 and S.1174, to award a Congressional Gold Medal to the 65th Infantry Regiment, known as Borinqueneers.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Award a Congressional Gold Medal to the 65th Infantry Regiment, known as Borinqueneers. (H.R.1726/S.1174)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of New York, in relation to requiring the reporting of environmental data regarding schools
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Reporting of environmental data regarding schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring that community planning boards receive an annual report submitted to the mayor with regard to projected and actual jobs created and retained in connection with projects undertaken by a certain contracted entity for the purpose of the creation or retention of jobs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Community planning boards receive an annual report submitted to the mayor with regard to projected and actual jobs created and retained in connection with projects undertaken by a certain contracted entity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating high needs areas within New York City as “digital technology empowerment zones.”
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Designating high needs areas within New York City as “digital technology empowerment zones.”

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Unified Court System to require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in New York City to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Require the Integrated Domestic Violence Courts in NYC to issue regular reports on batterer intervention programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to remedies for breach of the duty of an owner to refrain from harassment of tenants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Remedies for breach of the duty of an owner to refrain from harassment of tenants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation requiring the mandatory reporting of suspected elder abuse.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Requiring the mandatory reporting of suspected elder abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass, and the Governor to sign A.5336A and S.639, legislation authorizing banks to refuse payment of moneys when there is reason to believe that a vulnerable adult is being financially exploited.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Authorizing banks to refuse payment of moneys when there is reason to believe that a vulnerable adult is being financially exploited. (A.5336A/S.639)

Items.MatterName: Prohibiting jaywalking and providing for such violations to be adjudicated before the office of administrative trials and hearings.

Items.MatterName: Availability of local laws for review by Council Members.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Display of street numbers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of services provided to any private entity.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of services provided to any private entity.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring officers to identify themselves to the public
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Right to Know Act - Requiring officers to identify themselves to the public.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to price displays for second-hand automobiles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Price displays for second-hand automobiles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notice requirements for hotel development plans
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Notice requirements for hotel development plans.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.3525-A/S.3835-A, which would require the labeling of food or food products that contain genetically modified material or were produced using genetically modified material.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Require the labeling of food or food products that contain genetically modified material or were produced using genetically modified material. (A.3525-A/S.3835-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor to direct the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene and the New York City Human Resources Administration/Department of Social Services to develop and implement a comprehensive interdisciplinary response to gun violence.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Develop and implement a comprehensive interdisciplinary response to gun violence.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing every June as Gun Violence Awareness Month in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Recognizing every June as Gun Violence Awareness Month in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign into law S.6437/A.8574, also known as “Vivian’s Law,” which would make asking applicants about their criminal history on college admission forms illegal.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: Vivian’s Law (S.6437/A.8574)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increased penalties for illegal dumping.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Increased penalties for illegal dumping.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly and Senate to pass, and the Governor to sign, a State budget which does not bar the City of New York from using State reimbursements for rental subsidy programs for the homeless, and calling on the City of New York and State of New York to work together to create a rental subsidy program for the homeless.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: State budget which does not bar NYC from using State reimbursements for rental subsidy programs for the homeless.
